Docs.param: Name of the column resulting from the transformation of . The data type on this column will be a known-sized vector of .
Name of column to transform. If set to , the value of the will be used as source. This estimator operates on known-sized vector of data type.
The dimension of the feature space to map the input to.

If , use both of cos and sin basis functions to create two features for every random Fourier frequency. Otherwise, only cos bases would be used. Note that if set to , the dimension of the output feature space will be 2*.
The argument that indicates which kernel to use. The two available implementations are and .
The seed of the random number generator for generating the new features (if unspecified, the global random is used).
Docs.summary: Create an that maps input vectors to a low dimensional feature space where inner products approximate a shift-invariant kernel function.
